Entry.EnglishText: Nayla

Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: ナイラの家
Entry.EnglishText: Nayla's House

Entry.JapaneseText: モクラド村・<unk18:48D00480>
Entry.EnglishText: Mocrado Village - <unk18:48D00480>

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: ナイラの家
Entry.EnglishText: Nayla's House

Entry.JapaneseText: ナイラさん、 話を聞かせてください。
Entry.EnglishText: Nayla, please hear us out.

Entry.JapaneseText: 早く出ていってと言ってるのが わからないの!!
Entry.EnglishText: What part of "leave this place" do you not understand?!

Entry.JapaneseText: 娘が会いに来たのに、 どうしてそんな事言うんだよ!!
Entry.EnglishText: How could you say such things to your daughter after she came all this way to see you?!

Entry.JapaneseText: もう顔を合わせたくない！ いいから早く村から出ていって！
Entry.EnglishText: I don't want to see you anymore! Leave this village at once!

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたは、<Hilda>の大切にしていた タロットを破り捨てたんだ。 せめて、その理由だけでも……
Entry.EnglishText: Those Tarot Cards you tore apart were really important to <Hilda>. Could you at least explain why you...

Entry.JapaneseText: 理由なんて…… 理由なんて……！
Entry.EnglishText: You want to know why? You want to know why?!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……やっぱり…… 捨てた娘に会いたい親なんて…… いないのよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Well of course... There's no such thing as a parent who wants to reunite with the child they abandoned.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>……
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……おれはあきらめねぇぞ！ 何かとっかかりを探そうぜ！
Entry.EnglishText: Well, I ain't a quitter! Let's find a different lead!

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: ナイラの家
Entry.EnglishText: Nayla's House

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『作業机と本棚』 棚には古典関係の資料が並んでいる。 机の上の置物はネコの親子。 もの書きをしていたような跡も 残っている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Workbench and Bookshelves - The bookshelves contains works pertaining to the classics. An ornament of a mother and child lies on top of the workbench. There's still marks left by the writer who previously used it.

Entry.JapaneseText: カード……ナイラさんが 使っていたものか……
Entry.EnglishText: These were the cards Nayla used...

Entry.JapaneseText: あっ、カードだ。 ナイラさんが使ってた ものみたいだネ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh cards! It looks like Nayla used to use these.

Entry.JapaneseText: これは攻撃用のカードだな。 ナイラさんのものか……
Entry.EnglishText: These are attack cards... seems to be Nayla's...
Entry.Notes: 攻撃用 discuss better term for this word.

Entry.JapaneseText: 見てください。 すてきな絵柄のカードが ありますよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, come look, there are marvelous patterns painted atop these cards.

Entry.JapaneseText: お、カードだ。 占いの……じゃなさそうだな？
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, cards. These don't look like they're for fortune telling though?

Entry.JapaneseText: カード……
Entry.EnglishText: These cards...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>持っていきますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Take it with you? Yes No
Entry.Notes: It is referring to the card from the previous dialogue

Entry.JapaneseText: ハインデルタ…… 古代カレギア語で幸せの鳥…… 束縛からの解放……
Entry.EnglishText: Haindl... In ancient Callegean it means a bird of happiness... promising freedom from ones shackles.

Entry.JapaneseText: カード……占い用のものとは 少し違うようだな……
Entry.EnglishText: Cards... These don't look like they're used for fortune telling.

Entry.JapaneseText: あっ、カードだ。 勝手にもらうのは…… ダメだよネ？
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, cards. I guess it would be bad if I just take these, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: これは攻撃用のカードだな。 あまり使われたような形跡は ないな……
Entry.EnglishText: These are attack cards. Looks like there's not much evidence of them being used.

Entry.JapaneseText: すてきな絵柄のカードね。 珍しいものなのかしら？
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, what wonderful patterned cards! I wonder if these are rare?

Entry.JapaneseText: お、カードだ。 占いの……じゃなさそうだな？
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, cards. These don't look like they're for fortune telling though?

Entry.JapaneseText: 攻撃用のカード…… 見た事ないものだわ……
Entry.EnglishText: An attack card... I've never seen one before...
